result.name: music-education-hubs-annual-data-return
result.notes: Annual autumn data return by Department for Education funded music education hubs to Arts Council England, whom manage hubs on Department for Education's behalf.  There are currently 123 music education hubs funded across 2012 to 2015.  The return provides information on the impact of hubs' music education grants in terms of subsidising activities which support the core roles of the National Plan for Music Education  for the most recent Academic year.  This includes, for example, the number of maintained schools engaging with the hub, the numbers of pupils provided with free first access to music education and the numbers of ensembles and choirs organised by the hubs.  A report on the data will be produced for publication.

organization.name: department-for-education
organization.title: Department for Education
organization.description:
The Department for Education is responsible for education and children’s services in England. We work to achieve a highly educated society in which opportunity is equal for children and young people, no matter what their background or family circumstances.
DfE is a ministerial department, supported by 9 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-education

result.title: Music Education Hubs Annual Data Return

extras.value: It is likely that a report on the data will be released There are plans in place to release this data in January February 2014, though this is yet to be formally agreed.  Discussions to take place on who will publish the data, either the Department for Education or ACE will publish.
